rows.name: Test Experience and Knowledge
cells: No work experience of Software Testing
At least 0.5 year Software Testing experience and Intermediate level of primary skill.
At least 2 years Software Testing experience and Advanced level of primary skill.
At least 5 years Software Testing experience and Expert level of primary skill, and Advanced level of secondary skill.
At least 7 years Software Testing experience and Expert level of primary and two secondary skills.

rows.name: Software Process Knowledge
cells: Not expected to have knowledge or experience of Software Quality Control processes
Has Intermediate level of Software Quality Control process and SDLC. Able to follow a defined Software Quality Control process.
Has Advanced level of Software Quality Control process and SDLC. Able to follow and enhance a defined Software Quality Control process.
Has Expert level of Software Quality Control process and SDLC. Able to follow, actively influence and enhance a defined Software Quality Control process.
Has Expert level of Software Quality Control and other Software Engineering processes. Able to define Software Quality Control process.

rows.name: Design and Documentation Skills
cells: Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation, create test documentation (test cases for non-complex areas of the software product)
Able to read and understand project documentation, perform review and analysis of functional requirements and specifications, create test documentation (test cases and test results reports)

Shows good understanding of project documentation. Provides good-quality functional requirement and specification review and analysis. Creates high-quality test cases and test results reports. Creates test plans.

Shows strong understanding of project documentation. Provides high-quality functional requirement and specification review and analysis. Creates high-quality test plans, test cases and test result reports.

Shows perfect understanding of project documentation. Provides high-quality functional requirement and specification review and analysis. Creates high-quality test plans, test cases and test results reports

rows.name: Job Titles
cells: Junior Software Testing Engineer
Software Testing Engineer
Senior Software Testing Engineer
Lead Software Testing Engineer
Chief Software Testing Engineer

rows.name: Roles Played on a Project
cells: Plays the Tester role
Plays the Tester role
Plays the Tester (or Automation Tester) and Key Tester roles
Plays the Key Tester role, and usually also performs a Testing Team Lead, Project Coordinator, Reviewer or Auditor role.
Can play any role, typically a senior position. Responsibilities can include Key Tester, Testing Team Lead, Project Coordinator, Reviewer, Auditor, Technical Trainer and Process Engineer.

rows.name: Reliability
cells: Expected to work effectively under close supervision
Expected to perform primary testing tasks without direct supervision.
Expected to be self-managing and perform primary testing tasks without supervision. Takes testing responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project.

Expected to be self-managing and perform any tasks without supervision. Takes testing responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project.

Expected to have proven experience in evaluating theoretical knowledge and practical (on-the-job) skills and the seniority level of candidates and providing actionable feedback and recommendations on positions/projects matching.

Expected to be self-managing and perform any tasks without supervision. Takes testing responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project.

Expected to have proven experience in evaluating theoretical knowledge and practical (on-the-job) skills and the seniority level of candidates and providing actionable feedback and recommendations on positions/projects matching.

rows.name: Quality
cells: No specific expectations regarding quality

Must show a sense of responsibility for the results of the primary testing tasks he/she performs.

Creates deliverables in normal quality

Takes full responsibility for the results of the performed primary testing tasks.

Creates deliverables in good quality.

Takes full responsibility for the results of performing any tasks he/she is assigned for.

Must be a role model for colleagues; creates deliverables in high quality.

Takes full responsibility for the results of performing any tasks he/she is assigned for.

Must be a role model for colleagues, on a par with the best industry standards; creates deliverables in excellent quality.

rows.name: Customer Relations
cells: Not expected to deal directly with customers
Not expected to deal directly with customers
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; visit customers with supervision
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

Expected to have good customer relationship skills; participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

rows.name: Language Level in the Customer’s Communication Language
cells: Able to read and understand the Customer’s Communication Language
Able to read and write the Customer’s Communication Language and have some speaking ability
Comfortably able to read, write and speak the Customer’s Communication Language
Comfortably able to read, write and speak the Customer’s Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
Totally fluent in the spoken and written variants of the Customer’s Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
